title: Create new lib / module (reusable to others easily) for checking / alerting dangerous ENS names

labels.name: cat: ens
labels.description: Issues or features related to ENS functionality.

body:
See thread: https://github.com/ethereum/ens/issues/240#issuecomment-343386987

To be discussed on weekly call and actionable task-list created.

This library should provides methods to determine if a given string...

- contains mixed alphabets (cyrillic e's are rendered near identically and are widely used for phishing). 
     - The resource below posted by @Arachnid should be used for determining mixed alphabets. 
- contains punycode
- is similar to existing domains ([EAL list](https://github.com/409H/EtherAddressLookup/blob/master/blacklists/domains.json) can be used as dictionary). 
     - E.g. etherium is similar to ethereum. Levenshtein distance is used in EAL successfully to determine similarity. 
     - Note: The domain does not necessarily need to be registered on ENS for this method to provide an indication that it is similar.

Source code should be made publicly available under an MIT license, with MyCrypto handling the publishing of an npm package and providing maintenance for the library.

Library should be written in typescript, or at minimum javascript with typescript type declaration file included. 

Bonus points:
- Novel approach to determining a likely phishing domain without the requirement for an up-to-date static blacklist.

[This page from Chromium](https://www.chromium.org/developers/design-documents/idn-in-google-chrome) should be a good starting point on detecting deceiptive domains. Their process (under 'Google chrome's IDN policy') can be adapted for our purposes; the main criteria of interest here is that it blocks names that use mixed alphabets except for a few whitelisted cases where this is the norm.

__This issue now has a funding of 0.65 ETH (295.93 USD @ $455.27/ETH) attached to it.__ * If you would like to work on this issue you can claim it [here](https://gitcoin.co/issue/MyCryptoHQ/MyCrypto/382). * If you've completed this issue and want to claim the bounty you can do so [here](https://gitcoin.co/issue/MyCryptoHQ/MyCrypto/382) * Questions? Get help on the Gitcoin Slack * $2819.05 more Funded OSS Work Available at: https://gitcoin.co/explorer

Hey @Adexbafo

Thanks for picking up this task. How are things going for you so far? It would be great to open a dialogue on your approach to implementation, and we'd love to jump on a call / invite you to our slack so that we can facilitate communication to make sure we agree on the deliverable.
just removed the bounty hunter from this issue due to non response.
Hi @pakaplace! What is your approach for this bounty? Hope you are doing well ðŸ™‚
Hey @vs77bb  ! Giving it a shot. I'm working on the mixed alphabets part using the unicode ranges of the string components before moving onto the similar checker (3rd bullet point).
If I finished a draft of the mixed language section, should I "submit work" on Gitcoin? I'd like to push what I have so far in order to make sure I'm not totally off.
I should mention it's my first time developing a library. Maybe we should coordinate @dternyak ?

@pakaplace Hey! I've just setup [this](https://github.com/MyCryptoHQ/ens-validation) repo. Please feel free to open a PR against it with your on-going progress. We'll help give feedback and guide the development process.
@pakaplace has been removed from this issue due to inactivity (7 days) on the github thread. @pakaplace if you believe this was done in error, please go to the bounty and click 'start work' again.

hmm... looks like we need to update the gitcoinbot algo to check the PR and not just the activity on the issue itself.  @pakaplace does that seem okay to you?

[mind going back to the bounty and re-clicking 'start work'?](https://github.com/issue/MyCryptoHQ/MyCrypto/382)?

edit: looks like [this issue](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/issues/1913) is not related
I'll push tomorrow. Sorry for the delay. Have to convert to typescript

Hey @pakaplace 

I'm looking forwarding to reviewing your progress! Feel free to open a PR against [this](https://github.com/MyCryptoHQ/ens-validation) repo as mentioned before, and I'll send you some notes after I review
hey @pakaplace -- this issue expires soon.  just a heads up that i'm happy to pay after the expiratio date.  seems like theres been good progress so far!
Thanks @owocki , looking at Levenshtein distance right now. The gitcoin link expired unfortunately but we could sort it out later if the work is acceptable.
